com.martinandersson.javaee.jpa.entitymanagers

Interface EntityManagerExposer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContainerManagedTx, SingletonWithExtended, StatefulWithExtended1, StatefulWithExtended2, StatefulWithExtended3, StatelessWithExtended, TransactionalWithExtended, UnsynchronizedEM

    public interface EntityManagerExposer
    A bean that implements this interface has an entity manager ready to be exposed for some serious testing =)

    Yes, I originally called this type EntityManagerPimp.

    Is this interface used as an EJB business interface?

    By default in Java EE, an EJB that implements an interface (except Serializable and something more?) will loose his no-interface view and client code will become unable to declare and use a dependency of the EJB bean type alone.

    The implemented interface is being looked at as a "business interface" (a @Local one to be more precise) and it is the interface type that must be used as the type of the injection point.

    If the bean whish to implement this interface and keep exposing a no-interface view to client code, then the bean must be annotated @LocalBean.

    Author:
    Martin Andersson (webmaster at martinandersson.com)

      Will execute the provided test logic on the inside of the bean using the bean's entity manager.
